Package com.transdb

Class Transaction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.transdb.Transaction
  • public class Transaction
extends java.lang.Object
    This is Transaction Class. This class is container for multiple commands. A Transaction is a chain of commands. This class takes commands in a queue, then when it's fired, poll every command from queue, fire their execute method, then put command to transaction history, which is a stack. In case of any error in the transaction command chain, this stack will be used to undo.
    Author:
    Furkan KalabalÄ±k

        public void removeCommand​(Command command)

        Parameters:
        command - Command will be deleted from queue.

      • doTransaction

        public void doTransaction()
        This method fires the transaction. Perform commands in order until there is no command in queue. Takes return of every command. If any of fails, using commandHistory, undo every previous completed command. If there isn't any failed command, prints result.
